original: Blomgren, Axel Sigfrid, fd. rektor, Lerum, f. 3/8/79 i Hudiksvall av fabr. Axel Fredri|k B. o. Kristina Stålhammar. G. 1. 07 m. Judit Andrea Kristina Andersson, d. 38; 2. 45 m. Svea Johanna Johnsson. — Styrm:ex. 01, sjökapt:ex. 06, navig :sk :förest :ex. 08. I Konpstatens tjänst. 02-05, vik. lär. v. navig:sk. i Strömstad, Kalmar o. Gbg 07 o. 09-11, ord. navig :lär. v. navig:sk. i Gbg 12, förest."v. navig:sk. i Härnösand 26, lektor där o. rektor v. navig :sk. i Gbg 31-45. Insp. f. av länsstyr. i Gbgs o. Boh. 1. samt av Västkustfiskarnas centriförb. anordn. kurser i navig. m. m. f. Bohusl. o. Hall. fiskare. Led. av direkt, f. sjö-mansh. i Gbg 13-24, bisitt. i sjörättsmål v. rådihusr. i Härnösand 27-31. Skr.: utg. ett flert. lärob. i sign., sjö-mansk., eng., naut. meteorologi, maskinlära, radiopejling, navig., exempel-saml., log. o. naut. tab. m. m., eng.-sv. o. sv.-eng. ordb.. Nautisk Årsbok 16-48. RNO, RVO, RBESO, MC du Congo.
translated: Blomgren, Axel Sigfrid, former principal, Lerum, born August 3rd, 1879 in Hudiksvall to factory worker Axel Fredrik B. and Kristina Stålhammar. Married 1st in 1907 to Judit Andrea Kristina Andersson, who passed away in 1938; 2nd in 1945 to Svea Johanna Johnsson. He has a helmsman certificate from 1901, a ship's captain certificate from 1906, and a navigation school instructor certificate from 1908. He worked for the State Administration from 1902-1905, as a substitute teacher for navigation school in Strömstad, Kalmar, and Gothenburg in 1907 and from 1909-1911, as a regular navigation teacher at the navigation school in Gothenburg in 1912, as the head of the navigation school in Härnösand in 1926, as a lecturer there, and as the principal of the navigation school in Gothenburg from 1931-1945. He is an inspector for the County Administrative Board in Gothenburg and Bohus county, and for the West Coast fishermen's central association's courses in navigation etc. for the Bohuslän and Halland fishermen. He was a member of the board of directors of the Seamen's Association in Gothenburg from 1913-1924 and served as a legal advisor in maritime cases at the district court in Härnösand from 1927-1931. He has published several textbooks on navigation, seamanship, English, nautical meteorology, engineering, radio direction-finding, navigation, example collections, logarithms, and nautical tables, both English-Swedish and Swedish-English dictionaries, and the Nautical Yearbook from 1916-1948. He has been awarded the Royal Order of the North Star, the Royal Victorian Order, the Royal Belgian Order of the Lion, and the medal of the French Congo.
